name: Get Your Head Around These! 6 Quiz | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.text:
I am a blade, yet strange, but true

My fate is often to be cut by you

Cruelly mown down because I grew.

(Don't forget to read the hints)

Information conveyed by print or word of mouth

Initially coming from North, East, West & South.
questions.explanation:
News.

	Solution: NEWS is made from the initial letters of 'N'orth, 'E'ast, 'W'est, 'S'outh.

questions.text:
Until you speak I'll not be heard

I then respond to your every word.

Our description may cause surprise 

We have twelve faces and forty-two eyes

Yes we are a pair of   _ _ _ _ ?
questions.explanation:
dice & a dice & die.

	Dice is the plural, and die the singular form of the word.

questions.text:
I am always there, some distance away 

Somewhere between land or sea and sky I lay 

You may move toward me, yet distant I'll stay.

Take a female horse and chop off its tail

Now turn it around for a sheep that's male
questions.explanation:
ram & a ram.

	Take a female horse (mare)And chop of its tail (remove the 'e' it become 'mar')Turn it around ('mar' becomes 'ram' a male sheep)

questions.text:
Break me to make me better - I am immediately set

But now harder to break again - In sport, the best result yet.

If the wind blows only from the north

Where must I be on planet earth?

I start in July and end in November.

What's my name - can you decipher?
questions.explanation:
Jason.

	The initial letter of each month: J-uly A-ugust S-eptember O-ctober N-ovember, spell JASON.

questions.text:
I am a nut, but have no shell

Too many of me will make you swell 

Sweet on the outside, I don't always have a middle

Should be enough clues to solve this yummy riddle.
questions.correct: donut & doughnut & a donut & a doughnut & dough
questions.explanation: donut & doughnut & a donut & a doughnut & dough.
